Class NewAccountViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.NewAccountViewController
public class NewAccountViewController extends Object
Controller responsible for handling the "Create New Account" view.

This controller validates user input (username, email, password, confirm password), creates a new Client upon successful validation, registers it with the AccountService, clears the form, provides user feedback via alerts, and navigates to the main application view.

Validation rules

  • All fields are required.
  • Email must match a basic pattern: local@domain.tld
  • Passwords must match exactly.
  • The username "manager" (case-insensitive) is reserved and cannot be used.

Navigation

On successful account creation, this controller loads and shows /com/example/theaterproject/main-view.fxml in a new Stage and closes the current window.

    • EMAIL_PATTERN

      private final Pattern EMAIL_PATTERN
      Simple email validation pattern that enforces the presence of exactly one '@' and at least one dot after the '@'.

      Note: This is a basic format check and does not guarantee the address actually exists.

  • Method Details

    • onSignUpButtonClick

      private void onSignUpButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      FXML event handler for the "Sign Up" button.

      Delegates to handleSignUp(ActionEvent) to perform validations, account creation, and navigation.

      Parameters:
      pEvent - the originating action event from the UI

    • handleSignUp

      private void handleSignUp(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the full sign-up flow:
      1. Reads and trims user inputs from UI controls.
      2. Validates required fields, email format, password match, and reserved username.
      3. Constructs a Client and registers it with AccountService.
      4. Clears input fields and shows a success alert.
      5. Loads the main view and closes the current window.
      Any validation failure results in an error alert and an early return.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event that triggered sign-up (used to find the current window for closing)

    • clearFields

      private void clearFields()
      Clears all input fields in the sign-up form.

      Helpful after successful account creation or when resetting the form.
